item.title: Cases in all of Germany
item.description: Last modified: 2021-03-25. Data source: Our World In Data December 2, 2020: Our World In Data originally obtained their data from ECDC. They have since switched data source to John Hopkins, and the daily numbers looked different from ECDC/RKI, due to different ways of updating their data. Therefore I have switched data source to RKI which seems to be the primary source for ECDC. Cumulative number of confirmed SARS-CoV-2 cases in Germany in linear scale since March 15, 2020

item.title: Tracking the coronavirus outbreak in Germany from March 2020
item.description:
Last modified: 2021-03-25. This is my attempt to visualize some SARS-CoV-2 data with some R code (please pardon the non-optimal layout). German data is obtained from the Robert Koch Institute. Data used from March 15, 2020 (not updated every day). For more extensive information about SARS-CoV-2 in Germany in English, see here.
Cumulative number of confirmed SARS-CoV-2 cases in Germany in linear scale since 100th case

item.title: Comparing Coronavirus Cases in the World
item.description:
Last modified: 2020-04-14. This is my attempt to visualize some SARS-CoV-2 data with some R code (please pardon the non-optimal layout). German data is obtained from ECDC. Data used from December 31, 2019-April 14, 2020 (not updated every day).
Doubling time for new cases and deaths I chose 10 countries to compare the rates of increase (in terms of doubling time) for the number of cases and the number of deaths, similar to the [NYT case growth rate visualization].
